meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of mob rule or rule by a mob.
meanings.sent1: The mobocratic behavior of the unruly crowd caused chaos in the streets.
meanings.sent2: The town fell into a state of mobocratic frenzy during the protest.
meanings.sent3: The mobocratic tendencies of the group turned a peaceful gathering into a wild party.
meanings.sent4: The mobocratic nature of the situation made it feel like a scene from a chaotic movie.
meanings.sent5: The mobocratic atmosphere was thick with tension and unpredictability.

meanings.definition: Governed by a mob or characterized by mob rule.
meanings.sent1: The mobocratic decisions led to disorder and confusion in the community.
meanings.sent2: Living under mobocratic rule meant constant fear of unpredictable actions.
meanings.sent3: The mobocratic leadership style resulted in comical misunderstandings among the group.
meanings.sent4: The mobocratic influence spread like wildfire, engulfing everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The mobocratic regime was a turbulent rollercoaster of power struggles and unrest.
